Uses of Interface
com.vectorprint.report.data.ReportDataHolder

  • Packages that use ReportDataHolder 
    Package Description
    com.vectorprint.report
    interface for the generation of reports
    com.vectorprint.report.data
    interfaces to support the process of collecting data for reports
    com.vectorprint.report.itext
    primary classes for building iText reports; typically one will first study the possibilities of styling and annotating existing dataclasses, extend DataCollectorImpl and use ReportRunner to run the report.
    com.vectorprint.report.itext.style
    interfaces and classes to support configurable styling of iText reporting elements in a css like manner.
    com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers
    Parametrizable classes responsible for styling.
    com.vectorprint.report.running
    interface for building reports (independent from iText) and two ready to use implementations.

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ReportGenerator<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      Implementers will be responsible for writing a report to an OutputStream

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report.data

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.data with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataCollector<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      To generate a report we first need to collect data.
      interface  ReportDataAware<RD extends ReportDataHolder> 
      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.data that implement ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ReportDataHolderImpl
      Holder for data for reports, you can annotate classes of data Objects you add using Element and DataType to easily create and style report parts and format your data.

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report.itext

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BaseReportGenerator<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      This implementation of ReportGenerator uses a EventHelper and a ElementProducer to build an iText report.
      class  EventHelper<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      Responsible for printing headers, footers, debugging and failure information.

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DocumentStyler<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      Responsible for setting properties of the document such as page size, margins, encryption etc.
      Methods in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style that return ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReportDataHolder DocumentStyler.getData() 

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DocumentSettings<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      settings for a pdf, supports page size, margins and encryption.
      Methods in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers that return ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReportDataHolder DocumentSettings.getData() 

    • Uses of ReportDataHolder in com.vectorprint.report.running

      Classes in com.vectorprint.report.running with type parameters of type ReportDataHolder 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ReportBuilder<ARGS,RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      A report can be build by an implementor by calling ReportBuilder.buildReport(java.lang.Object) which in turn can/should use a DataCollector and a ReportGenerator to build the report.
      class  ReportRunner<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
      This implementation does not depend on iText and may be subclassed to generate reports of other tastes.
